customer_reviews.title: GOOD PAN FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Great circle roaster. This isn’t non stick so be aware and make sure you grease or spray prior to use, if you’re making something like a casserole. I love the circle shape and the price was right so we bought it. It’s very light and the lid doesn’t fit tight, so if you need to really trap steam or keep the heat in I recommend a piece of foil over the top then place the lid. Other than those few things it’s a great pan, good size, fun shape. Good value for the money.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is exactly the right size for a chicken on rice with a few potatoes, which we make every week for Shabbos. We got very frustrated trying to cover a pan in tinfoil every week, so we decided to try this pan. For the price, I wasn't expecting much, but it's outstanding. The chicken was moist and delicious, as were the rice and potatoes. It's a very lightweight pan, which I like because it's easy to lift even full and cools down quickly. It also goes through our dishwasher with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for stews when camping!
customer_reviews.text: We got this as we wanted an enamelware pot with a lid. This seemed to be the only enamel pot of a smaller size for camping that included a lid. We were very happy with the order and can now make our covered chicken stews and chili over a propane stove (although, we still prefer it in a dutch oven!). This fits well on a coleman propane 2-burner as well. Note: the photo makes it look oval-shaped, but it is a full circle. I wasn't sure of this when ordering, but was fine either way with its shape.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Riel

customer_reviews.title: Great Stovetop Pan!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Amazon several years ago. I use it for cooking potatoes (great pan for mashing them) and for cooking smaller amounts of pasta. It is the perfect pan for cooking those foods for a small family. I think "casserole" is a misnomer, as it leads some buyers to expect a heavyweight pan, which this is not. It's just a good old-fashioned serviceable pan that has held up very well. As with any enamelware, be careful to avoid chipping the finish. Update--also super for cooking smaller amounts of pasta. Have been using it for years, and it is one of the most-used pans in my kitchen.

The speckle-ware is reminiscent of my great-grandmother's cookware, but this is thinner than hers and will have hotspots on the bottom, so be careful with cooking times. I would buy this again.

product_meta.title: Granite Ware Covered Casserole, 5-Quart, Black
product_meta.description: Size:5 QuartOriginally founded in 1871, Columbian Home Products is the oldest cookware manufacturer in the U.S., famous for producing Porcelain on Steel cookware. Granite Ware has a carbon steel core for strength, conductivity and superior heat distribution. Porcelain is fused to the steel at 2,000 degrees Fahrenheit producing a non-porous, inert glass surface that is naturally non-stick. Porcelain can chip if dropped, however this does not reduce the effectiveness of the cookware. There are no PTFE’s, PFOA’s or any other chemicals to change the taste, color or nutritional value of the food. Just the right size for empty nesters, singles, college students or use in a second home. A smaller version of the traditional casserole. Perfect for cooking your favorite dishes in smaller portions or use to cook and serve side dishes. Includes Lid and capacity is 5 quarts.
